snippet: The sideline, and the end line, is the domain of football’s acrobats, its tightrope walkers and contortionists, where the fundamental art of catching a pass becomes a balance-beam routine.
abstract: Sideline catches in football emphasize artistry, requiring receivers to have more than just ball-reception skills; New York Giants wide receiver Mario Manningham tiptoed into fame in 2011 by snaring a 38-yard pass from quarterback Eli Manning that ignited the team’s winning drive in Super Bowl XLVI.
lead_paragraph: The sideline, and the end line, is the domain of football’s acrobats, its tightrope walkers and contortionists, where the fundamental art of catching a pass becomes a balance-beam routine.

headline.main: Falling Out of Bounds, and Into the Spotlight
headline.print_headline: Falling Out of Bounds, and Into the Spotlight
